comment: The size of the set of closed walks of prime length ` N ` is divisible by ` N ` . This corresponds to statement 9 in [Huneke] p. 2: "It follows that, if p is a prime number, then the number of closed walks of length p is divisible by p". (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 6-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 4-May-2021.)
